meanings.definition: Not occurring or existing at the same time as something else.
meanings.sent1: The two clocks in the room were nonsynchronous, showing different times.
meanings.sent2: The nonsynchronous arrival of the buses caused confusion at the station.
meanings.sent3: The nonsynchronous dance moves of the performers created a comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: Her nonsynchronous footsteps echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The nonsynchronous chirping of the birds made the forest feel alive with sound variations.

meanings.definition: Not happening or moving at the same time or in the same way.
meanings.sent1: The nonsynchronous wipers on the car made it challenging to clear the windshield.
meanings.sent2: The nonsynchronous beats in the music gave it a unique and unpredictable rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The nonsynchronous movements of the dancers made the performance mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: His nonsynchronous thoughts seemed to wander in different directions simultaneously.
meanings.sent5: The nonsynchronous flow of traffic created a chaotic scene on the streets.
